visualization_explanation: The dataset represents a one-dimensional composition of Earth's atmospheric layers with six categorical variables. Each layer's proportional representation uses normalized stacking despite equal data values (all [1]), creating an effective visual metaphor for atmospheric stratification. Synthetic height ranges and descriptions maintain scientific accuracy through NASA-derived reference values while simplifying complex gradations into discrete bands. The stacked column chart maximizes data-ink ratio by eliminating axes and gridlines, focusing attention on layer proportions and annotations. Color progression from dark blue to light gray visually encodes atmospheric density gradients, implementing Cairo's perceptual principle of magnitude expression through value contrast. Equal data values (μ=1, σ=0) create uniform segments that proportionally represent conceptual atmospheric divisions rather than quantitative measures.
